alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 9:58PM EST until February 17 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past twenty four hours has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 25.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CST Thursday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 25.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 14.9 feet early Monday morning. It will rise to 15.9 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued late Friday morning.
